weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, the city appears to be wrapped in a gentle embrace of clouds, casting a soft gray veil over the skyline. Tonight’s weather holds a sense of calm: with temperatures hovering around 50 degrees, a light west-southwest breeze stirs the air, whispering promises of a cooler, serene evening. The low-lying fog, typical for this time of year, blankets the bay, lending a soothing yet mysterious ambiance to familiar streets, as if inviting you to stroll through the shadowy silhouettes of the buildings.

Tomorrow gleams with the promise of a brighter outlook, with expected warmth as the morning sun peeks through the clouds. By midday, the city will bask in mostly sunny conditions, nudging the mercury up to a pleasant 65 degrees. Ideal for a relaxed exploration, this is the day to don layers—a comfortable sweater or light jacket to combat the morning chill will soon be replaced by the freedom of a t-shirt in the afternoon sun. As the forecast teases brighter hours, consider taking a leisurely walk along the Embarcadero, perhaps pausing at a cozy café to sip a warm drink while absorbing the vibrant energy of the city as it wakes.
